alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 11:04AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack which will keep river flows elevated. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Palisade. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. No flooding occurs. This is about 2600 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM PDT Tuesday, June 06 the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 6.2 feet. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tomorrow afternoon at 1200 PM PDT.
